treeQuadrature.samplers.base_class module¶

class treeQuadrature.samplers.base_class.Sampler[source]¶

Bases: ABC

static handle_mins_maxs(mins: ndarray, maxs: ndarray)[source]¶

Check the shapes of mins, maxs

Returns:

  • tuple

  • mins, maxs (np.ndarray) – reshaped to (D,) when necessary

  • D (int) – the dimension of the sampler

abstract rvs(n: int, mins: ndarray, maxs: ndarray, f: callable, *args, **kwargs) → Tuple[ndarray, ndarray][source]¶

A method to generate random samples

Argument¶

nint

number of samples

mins, maxsnp.ndarray

1 dimensional arrays of the lower bounds and upper bounds

ffunction

the integrand

*args, **kwargs

other necessary arguments and keyward arguments

returns:

(xs, ys) xs is np.ndarray of shape (n, D) ys is np.ndarray of shape (n, ) samples from the distribution

rtype:

tuple

static subdivide_domain(strata_per_dim: int, mins: ndarray, maxs: ndarray) → List[Tuple[ndarray, ndarray]][source]¶

Subdivide the domain into smaller strata.

For stratified samplers.

Parameters:

  • strata_per_dim (int) – Number of strata per dimension.

  • mins (np.ndarray) – Lower bounds of the domain.

  • maxs (np.ndarray) – Upper bounds of the domain.

Returns:

Subdivided strata as a list of (low, high) tuples.

Return type:

list of tuples

treeQuadrature.samplers.combined_samplers module¶

class treeQuadrature.samplers.combined_samplers.AdaptiveImportanceSampler(strata_per_dim: int = 10, oversample_factor: int = 5)[source]¶

Bases: Sampler

rvs(n: int, mins: ndarray, maxs: ndarray, f: Callable, max_samples_per_region: int = 50, **kwargs) → Tuple[ndarray, ndarray][source]¶

Two-stage sampling that first adapts to the integrand’s values and then applies importance sampling.

Parameters:

  • n (int) – Number of samples.

  • mins (np.ndarray) – 1-dimensional arrays of the lower bounds and upper bounds.

  • maxs (np.ndarray) – 1-dimensional arrays of the lower bounds and upper bounds.

  • f (callable) – The integrand function to be sampled.

  • max_samples_per_region (int, optional) – Maximum number of samples allowed in any given region to prevent over-sampling.

Returns:

xsnp.ndarray of shape (n, D)

The sampled points.

ysnp.ndarray of shape (n, )

The integrand values at the sampled points.

Return type:

Tuple[np.ndarray, np.ndarray]

class treeQuadrature.samplers.combined_samplers.LHSImportanceSampler(oversample_factor: int = 10, epsilon: float = 1e-10)[source]¶

Bases: Sampler

rvs(n: int, mins: ndarray, maxs: ndarray, f: callable, max_samples_per_region: int = 50, **kwargs) → Tuple[ndarray, ndarray][source]¶

Latin Hypercube Sampling (LHS) combined with importance sampling.

Parameters:

  • n (int) – Number of samples.

  • mins (np.ndarray) – 1-dimensional arrays of the lower bounds and upper bounds.

  • maxs (np.ndarray) – 1-dimensional arrays of the lower bounds and upper bounds.

  • f (callable) – The integrand function to be sampled.

  • max_samples_per_region (int, optional) – Maximum number of samples allowed in any given region to prevent over-sampling. Default is 50.

Returns:

xsnp.ndarray of shape (n, D)

The sampled points.

ysnp.ndarray of shape (n, )

The integrand values at the sampled points.

Return type:

Tuple[np.ndarray, np.ndarray]

Importance sampling with a bias towards edges and corners.

  • mins (np.ndarray) – 1 dimensional arrays of the lower bounds and upper bounds

  • maxs (np.ndarray) – 1 dimensional arrays of the lower bounds and upper bounds

  • f (function) – the integrand

Returns:

treeQuadrature.samplers.mcmc_sampler module¶

class treeQuadrature.samplers.mcmc_sampler.McmcSampler(n_walkers: int = 10, burning: int = 0, temperature: float = 1.0)[source]¶

Bases: Sampler

MCMC sampler that generates samples from the modulus of f using the emcee package. Allows sampling from a heated version of |f|.

rvs(n: int, mins: ndarray, maxs: ndarray, f: callable, **kwargs) → Tuple[ndarray, ndarray][source]¶

Generate exactly n MCMC samples using the EnsembleSampler.

Parameters:

  • n (int) – Number of samples to generate.

  • mins (np.ndarray) – 1-dimensional arrays of the lower and upper bounds.

  • maxs (np.ndarray) – 1-dimensional arrays of the lower and upper bounds.

  • f (callable) – The integrand function from which to sample.

Returns:

The generated samples and their corresponding function values.

Return type:

Tuple[np.ndarray, np.ndarray]

treeQuadrature.samplers.mixed_sampler module¶

class treeQuadrature.samplers.mixed_sampler.MixedSampler(samplers: List[Sampler], proportions: List[float] | None = None)[source]¶

Bases: Sampler

A sampler that combines multiple samplers, drawing samples from each according to specified proportions.

rvs(n: int, mins: ndarray, maxs: ndarray, f: callable, **kwargs) → Tuple[ndarray, ndarray][source]¶

Generate samples by combining samples from multiple samplers according to the specified proportions.

Parameters:

  • n (int) – Total number of samples to generate.

  • mins (np.ndarray) – 1-dimensional arrays of the lower and upper bounds.

  • maxs (np.ndarray) – 1-dimensional arrays of the lower and upper bounds.

  • f (callable) – The integrand function from which to sample.

Returns:

The generated samples and their corresponding function values.

Return type:

Tuple[np.ndarray, np.ndarray]
